body:
> > Why not recover from the minimum cmq physical offset when abnormally exiting🤔?
> 
> collect all consumer queue last message's commit log physical offset, and use the minimum as the reputService's reputFromOffset(now is the maxPhysicalPosInLogicQueue).

@suopovate  Emmm, looks like this is the first way I mentioned.

> > > Why not recover from the minimum cmq physical offset when abnormally exiting🤔?
> > 
> > 
> > collect all consumer queue last message's commit log physical offset, and use the minimum as the reputService's reputFromOffset(now is the maxPhysicalPosInLogicQueue).
> 
> @suopovate Emmm, looks like this is the first way I mentioned.
Maybe, I think my way is the simplest, just change the 'reputFromOffset' value, finally the data will be normal, and no data loss.🤓
We needn't not keep the cache of consumer queue flushed offset.

> > > > Why not recover from the minimum cmq physical offset when abnormally exiting🤔?
> > > 
> > > 
> > > collect all consumer queue last message's commit log physical offset, and use the minimum as the reputService's reputFromOffset(now is the maxPhysicalPosInLogicQueue).
> > 
> > 
> > @suopovate Emmm, looks like this is the first way I mentioned.
> > Maybe, I think my way is the simplest, just change the 'reputFromOffset' value, finally the data will be normal, and no data loss.🤓
> > We needn't not keep the cache of consumer queue flushed offset.

@suopovate 
- In fact, this also has some disadvantages. Some queues may only generate a few messages, which means that its endOffset is very small. In this case, we will rebuilding almost all cqs.
- By the cache, we can add the dimension of time to more reasonably determine the offset which the broker should begin to recover at.

> > > > > Why not recover from the minimum cmq physical offset when abnormally exiting🤔?
> > > > 
> > > > 
> > > > collect all consumer queue last message's commit log physical offset, and use the minimum as the reputService's reputFromOffset(now is the maxPhysicalPosInLogicQueue).
> > > 
> > > 
> > > @suopovate Emmm, looks like this is the first way I mentioned.
> > > Maybe, I think my way is the simplest, just change the 'reputFromOffset' value, finally the data will be normal, and no data loss.🤓
> > > We needn't not keep the cache of consumer queue flushed offset.
> 
> @suopovate
> 
> * In fact, this also has some disadvantages. Some queues may only generate a few messages, which means that its endOffset is very small. In this case, we will rebuilding almost all cqs.
> * By the cache, we can add the dimension of time to more reasonably determine the offset which the broker should begin to recover at.

Emmm, indeed I left out the question.
I will try to fix it in local, thanks for your suggestion.🫡
may be you can assign this to me, I'd like to submit a pr and fix it

Why is this a bug? I don't get it. I think the condition `System.currentTimeMillis() - Long.parseLong(consumeStartTimeStamp)` will be calculated before the compare, even without the brackets.
you can see http://c.biancheng.net/view/794.html
maybe you can assign this to me, I'd like to fix it.
BTW, may I ask how you execute terminal commands like `ExportConfigsCommand` when debugging RocketMQ in Idea? Thanks a lot~

> BTW, may I ask how you execute terminal commands like `ExportConfigsCommand` when debugging RocketMQ in Idea? Thanks a lot~

直接跑源码debug 或者 执行sh脚本的时候开启远程端口然后再IDEA调试都可以的
put null 是因为哪个参数没了？

> put null 是因为哪个参数没了？

filterServerNums

> suggest name this pr like `[ISSUE #xxx] xxxxx`

ok

> Hello,I have a question. If System is exit abnormal, when restart, rocketMq will call recoverAbnormally() to recover consumerQueue and index data. So why we need to fix the data? 🧐 Maybe I need to try reproduction this bug. That's the code :


It seems that this case has indeed been considered, but we are using DLedger mode, and the recovery logic of dLedgerCommitLog does not have this process. This should be the cause.

> > Hello,I have a question. If System is exit abnormal, when restart, rocketMq will call recoverAbnormally() to recover consumerQueue and index data. So why we need to fix the data? 🧐 Maybe I need to try reproduction this bug. That's the code :
> 
> It seems that this case has indeed been considered, but we are using DLedger mode, and the recovery logic of dLedgerCommitLog does not have this process. This should be the cause.

That should be it, I made some time to research it 🥲... Thanks, I will be to learn about DLedger.

It's my fault,

It's my habit to write with '()'

> 建议根据条件判断是否启用这些服务

粗略看了一下，在启动过程中没有对应的参数能够判断当前client的类型，使用什么条件做判断比较好呢

> 
> 粗略看了一下，在启动过程中没有对应的参数能够判断当前client的类型，使用什么条件做判断比较好呢

clientConfig instanceof xxx 判断?

> > 
> > 
> > 粗略看了一下，在启动过程中没有对应的参数能够判断当前client的类型，使用什么条件做判断比较好呢

nice idea!
@shirenchuang maybe you can assign this issue to me, I'd like to do this issue
@RongtongJin Please check it.

> > > 建议根据条件判断是否启用这些服务
> > 
> > 
> > 粗略看了一下，在启动过程中没有对应的参数能够判断当前client的类型，使用什么条件做判断比较好呢
> 
> clientConfig instanceof xxx 判断?

不能通过这个来判断，这个只是在第一次创建 MQClientInstance的时候才有用，MQClientInstance 是共用的；

通过consumerTable来判断就行了

> > > > 建议根据条件判断是否启用这些服务
> > > 
> > > 
> > > 粗略看了一下，在启动过程中没有对应的参数能够判断当前client的类型，使用什么条件做判断比较好呢
> > 
> > 
> > clientConfig instanceof xxx 判断?
> 
> 不能通过这个来判断，这个只是在第一次创建 MQClientInstance的时候才有用，MQClientInstance 是共用的；
> 
> 通过consumerTable来判断就行了

确实，clientConfig是有问题，没考虑到，consumerTable判断好

Sry, I think the configuration files are all from official binary release package so I did not paste them. Here is all the information of binary package and configuration files using in test:

1. Binary package source: [rocketmq-all-5.1.3-bin-release.zip](https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/release/rocketmq/5.1.3/rocketmq-all-5.1.3-bin-release.zip)

2. Original configurations thoes worked: All same to the `rocketmq-all-5.1.3-bin-release\conf\controller\quick-start\*.conf`

3. Test configurations thoes did not work:
    
3.1. `rocketmq-all-5.1.3-bin-release\conf\controller\quick-start\namesrv.conf`:
    
```properties
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more

controllerDLegerSelfId = n0
```
    
3.2.  `rocketmq-all-5.1.3-bin-release\conf\controller\quick-start\broker-n0.conf`:
    
```properties
# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one or more

brokerClusterName = DefaultCluster
brokerName = broker-b
brokerId = -1
brokerRole = SLAVE
deleteWhen = 04
fileReservedTime = 48
enableControllerMode = true
controllerAddr = 127.0.0.1:9878
namesrvAddr = 127.0.0.1:9876
allAckInSyncStateSet=true
listenPort=30911
storePathRootDir=/tmp/rmqstore/node00
storePathCommitLog=/tmp/rmqstore/node00/commitlog
```
    
3.3.  `rocketmq-all-5.1.3-bin-release\conf\controller\quick-start\broker-n1.conf`:
    
```properties

deleteWhen = 04

namesrvAddr = 127.0.0.1:9876
```

> you can paste the link of the `quick start` and the config you are using here

You can easily see that I have just replaced those two broker name from "broker-a" to "broker-b", just that, no more modification.

And for more details:

1. After I moified the configurations, I have stopped and restarted all the services include of two brokers, namesrv, dashboard. I think there won't be any problems caused by cache.

2. I have tried with the default configurations and see the correct cluster information successfully firstly, and then I modified them to do the contrast test. Dose this order matter? Is there any remain log files could affect the behavior of controller so I won't get a right result when I restart them without removing the log file? But I'm not very clear about which log files will be responsible for that.
Thanks for your information, I will check this out

> Thanks for your information, I will check this out

Thanks for your reply. I'm glad that you can reproduce it. I just think it as a enviroment problem at first.
you can delete the dir `storePathRootDir=/tmp/rmqstore/node00` in the broker config and restart namesrv and broker, you will see broker-b alive

> you can delete the dir `storePathRootDir=/tmp/rmqstore/node00` in the broker config and restart namesrv and broker, you will see broker-b alive

Thanks, it does work, Maybe we can close this issue now.
By the way, now I think I finally know why there were always some wired, incongruent behaviours in my tests in quasi-production enviroment...
you are welcome!

是这样的。我是用的MQAdminExt.createAndUpdatePlainAccessConfig(final String addr, final PlainAccessConfig plainAccessConfig); 不是命令行工具。 如果把topicpermit 或grouppermit 设置为空list。会被org.apache.rocketmq.broker.processor.AdminBrokerProcessor.updateAndCreateAccessConfig(ChannelHandlerContext, RemotingCommand) 中 UtilAll.split(requestHeader.getTopicPerms(), ",") 解析为包含一个空串的list，org.apache.rocketmq.acl.plain.PlainPermissionManager.updateAccessConfig(PlainAccessConfig) 这里的    Permission.checkResourcePerms(plainAccessConfig.getTopicPerms()); 会报错格式不正确

循环体内不是已经有方法调用了嘛： `byteBuffer.put((int) i, (byte) 0);`  难道这个方法调用不能当做“安全点”？
我猜测不能当安全点的原因是：JIT在编译byteBuffer.put((int) i, (byte) 0); 这段代码的时候，会进行内联操作？

还有一个疑问，我理解无论是 1. Thread.sleep  2. 还是把int 换成long， 都是为了手动在for循环体内放置一个安全点。 为什么手动放置一个安全点就达到优化性能的效果了呢？

原因难道是这样：
1、有安全点的话，虚拟机通过“短暂的停顿”，就能枚举需要被回收的对象，所有“短暂的停顿”所累积的时间记为t1
2、如果不放置安全点，可能会导致full GC, 将GC的时间记为t2
**t1 远小于 t2?**

如果原因真是这样，想请问 t1 和 t2之间的量级差多少？
